item.title: doctests
item.description: Consider some small utility function such as: def parse_string(input: str): try: name, value = input.split(':') except ValueError: name = input value = None assert name, input return name, value These utility functions typically have a small footprint, and they are usually tested by writing unittests for functions that call these small utility functions/method. Testing them directly within the test suite can be done, but if you start adding multiple files for multiple utility functions keeping track of the changes can become a chore.

item.title: Deliberate
item.description: Just a reminder to be intentional with time and deliberate in action.
